notesStmt.note: Several larger lacunas, esp. after folio 239.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Parts of the Hagiographa, provided with vowel-points and accents, masorah magna and parva. Most of the books have an Arabic translation.

msItem.title: Fragment of Psalms, unpunctuated, with Arabic translation in alternate verses.
Fragment of Ruth, unpunctuated, with Targum and Arabic translation.
Comments (mostly following Rashi) on passages in Ps. 7-42.

collation.p:
25 quires: i-v(10), vi(10-1), vii-xx(10), xxi(12-3), xxii-xxiv(10), xxv(12).
Quires signed with Arabic numbers on the first and last pages.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Yemenite square script, punctuated, of the 15th to 16th century.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine: 'Song of Sol. Lamentations. Etc. With Targum & Ara. Vers. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 1480.'

history.provenance:
Acquisition:
Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), a antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 24 November 1877; inscribed back flyleaf [i]v; numbering 'No 12' (corrected to 11) probably by him on folio 1r.
